title: The Invoice paid action is incomplete if there is a proforma behind it
description: The flow is the following: 1 - I create a draft Proforma - The payment is not visible and unpaid (OK) 2 - I issue the proforma. The payment is visible and unpaid (OK) 3 - I create the invoice from proforma. The payment is visible and unpaid (OK) 4 - I go on the invoice and click Pay this invoice. The invoice moves to paid (OK), the proforma stays at issued (NOT OK, it should move to paid), the payment is visible and unpaid (NOT OK, it should move to paid) To be sure other documents flows are working as expected: I tested also the flow: 1 - same 2 - same 3 - same 4 - click pay this proforma. This is working ok, The proforma goes to paid, the invoice goes to paid, the payments goes to paid I tested also the flow: 1 - created a draft invoice (no proforma attached), payment is not visible and unpaid (OK) 2 - issued the invoice, payment is visible and unpaid (OK) 3 - pay this invoice, invoice goes to paid, payments goes to paid (OK)
text_for_topic_modeling: The Invoice paid action is incomplete if there is a proforma behind it The flow is the following: 1 - I create a draft Proforma - The payment is not visible and unpaid (OK) 2 - I issue the proforma. The payment is visible and unpaid (OK) 3 - I create the invoice from proforma. The payment is visible and unpaid (OK) 4 - I go on the invoice and click Pay this invoice. The invoice moves to paid (OK), the proforma stays at issued (NOT OK, it should move to paid), the payment is visible and unpaid (NOT OK, it should move to paid) To be sure other documents flows are working as expected: I tested also the flow: 1 - same 2 - same 3 - same 4 - click pay this proforma. This is working ok, The proforma goes to paid, the invoice goes to paid, the payments goes to paid I tested also the flow: 1 - created a draft invoice (no proforma attached), payment is not visible and unpaid (OK) 2 - issued the invoice, payment is visible and unpaid (OK) 3 - pay this invoice, invoice goes to paid, payments goes to paid (OK) source-file test-file test-file

title: Missing dependency xhtml2pdf
description: pip install django-silver Add silver to installed apps and try to run migration it fails. django-silver version 0.6.1 `[vagrant@dev workspace]$ ./manage.py migrate silver Traceback (most recent call last): File "./manage.py", line 13, in <module> execute_from_command_line(sys.argv) File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/django/core/management/__init__.py", line 364, in execute_from_command_line utility.execute() File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/django/core/management/__init__.py", line 338, in execute django.setup() File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/django/__init__.py", line 27, in setup apps.populate(settings.INSTALLED_APPS) File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/django/apps/registry.py", line 108, in populate app_config.import_models() File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/django/apps/config.py", line 202, in import_models self.models_module = import_module(models_module_name) File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/importlib/__init__.py", line 37, in import_module __import__(name) File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/silver/models/__init__.py", line 16, in <module> from documents import Proforma, Invoice, BillingDocumentBase, DocumentEntry, PDF File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/silver/models/documents/__init__.py", line 16, in <module> from .base import BillingDocumentBase File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/silver/models/documents/base.py", line 43, in <module> from silver.models.documents.pdf import PDF File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/silver/models/documents/pdf.py", line 3, in <module> from xhtml2pdf import pisa ImportError: No module named xhtml2pdf` `pip install xhtml2pdf ` fixes this issue.
text_for_topic_modeling: Missing dependency xhtml2pdf pip install django-silver Add silver to installed apps and try to run migration it fails. django-silver version 0.6.1 `[vagrant@dev workspace]$ ./manage.py migrate silver Traceback (most recent call last): File "./manage.py", line 13, in <module> execute_from_command_line(sys.argv) File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/django/core/management/__init__.py", line 364, in execute_from_command_line utility.execute() File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/django/core/management/__init__.py", line 338, in execute django.setup() File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/django/__init__.py", line 27, in setup apps.populate(settings.INSTALLED_APPS) File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/django/apps/registry.py", line 108, in populate app_config.import_models() File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/django/apps/config.py", line 202, in import_models self.models_module = import_module(models_module_name) File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/importlib/__init__.py", line 37, in import_module __import__(name) File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/silver/models/__init__.py", line 16, in <module> from documents import Proforma, Invoice, BillingDocumentBase, DocumentEntry, PDF File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/silver/models/documents/__init__.py", line 16, in <module> from .base import BillingDocumentBase File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/silver/models/documents/base.py", line 43, in <module> from silver.models.documents.pdf import PDF File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/silver/models/documents/pdf.py", line 3, in <module> from xhtml2pdf import pisa ImportError: No module named xhtml2pdf` `pip install xhtml2pdf ` fixes this issue. other-file other-file source-file source-file

title: Option to copy date from an existing document
description: For Proforma and also Invoice, i need the option, that in case i create a new document from scratch, to copy the data from an existing document. (All data except the document series and number). The business case is, if a document is wrong then i cancel it and then i create a new one from zero by copy-paste field by field which for multiple lines is a big pain. The idea is to copy all from a selected document and then to modify it:)

title: generated pdf contains only the address of an _io.BytesIO object
description: Hi! Python 2.7, Django 1.11, django-silver 0.7.0 Despite my best efforts, all pdf files that I produce from invoices have a size of exaclty 38 bytes & contain something like "<_io.BytesIO object at 0x7f3ef8eb8ad0>". There is no error or debug message when I generate a pdf file either with the manager or directly in the shell with an invoice instance: invoice.generate_pdf :-( My guess is that there is something wrong with the templates but I am not sure. I put a copy of the templates provided in the source in all possible paths. I guessed from the code that the template path should include the slug name of the provider: (my test project is called copper, the first 'copper' folder is the one containing manage.py) copper/copper/templates/billing_documents/presslabs-srl/invoice_pdf.html i also used all combinations of templates/copper/billing_documents/presslabs-srl/invoice_pdf.html templates/silver/billing_documents/presslabs-srl/invoice_pdf.html etc my settings module looks like this: TEMPLATES = [ { 'BACKEND': 'django.template.backends.django.DjangoTemplates', 'DIRS': [ #PROJECT_ROOT + '/payment_processors/templates/', PROJECT_ROOT + '/templates/', ], 'APP_DIRS': True, 'OPTIONS': { If someone has an idea what I got wrong, I would appreciate it a lot if she/he could give me an hint. Thanks a lot! jrme

title: Remove django-storages hard dependecy
description: An application user should be able to use this app without requiring to save to S3. He can simply use https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.7/ref/files/storage/ . We should add a `SILVER_DOCUMENT_PREFIX` setting to prepend to the upload callable and `SILVER_DOCUMENT_STORAGE` for specifying the storage backend.
text_for_topic_modeling: Remove django-storages hard dependecy An application user should be able to use this app without requiring to save to S3. He can simply use https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/1.7/ref/files/storage/ . title: Bill the value of ended subscriptions only at the new billing cycle
description: If a customer has `consolidated_billing` and a subscription is ended during the month, bill the corresponding value only at the new billing cycle. The exception is when the ended subscription is the last on that the customer has. In this case, the proforma/invoice has to be issued when ending the subscription. When this exception occurs the subscription with the `canceling` state have to be billed too.
patched_file_types: other-file | test-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | source-file | other-file | test-file | test-file

The exception is when the ended subscription is the last on that the customer has. In this case, the proforma/invoice has to be issued when ending the subscription. When this exception occurs the subscription with the `canceling` state have to be billed too. other-file test-file source-file source-file source-file source-file source-file other-file test-file test-file

title: Lax requirered versions
description: This is an installable app. We should not pin versions in `requirements.txt` unless there is really a specific reason to do this. Some people may be in a situation in that they cannot install `silver` because they cannot move to the specific of a required package.
text_for_topic_modeling: Lax requirered versions This is an installable app. We should not pin versions in `requirements.txt` unless there is really a specific reason to do this. Some people may be in a situation in that they cannot install `silver` because they cannot move to the specific of a required package. other-file

title: Wrong data in invoices/proforma when subscription is canceled
description: So in the middle of the month the customer decides to move. We cancel the subscription in billing and the expected result is that the new billing cycle invoice to have only the extra pageviews included on it and no more full month subscription. Well, the Billing subscription moved to ended, but the current month subscription package got invoiced wrongly on top of the expected extra pageviews.
text_for_topic_modeling: Wrong data in invoices/proforma when subscription is canceled So in the middle of the month the customer decides to move. We cancel the subscription in billing and the expected result is that the new billing cycle invoice to have only the extra pageviews included on it and no more full month subscription. Well, the Billing subscription moved to ended, but the current month subscription package got invoiced wrongly on top of the expected extra pageviews. source-file test-file source-file test-file

title: Update due date = issue date for paid invoices
description: When invoices are created from payments we need to have the due date = issue date as there is no point to add more days for payment when the payment is already done

title: Investigate/fix updates on cloned invoice/proforma
description: 1. Clone a proforma 2. Make some changes to that proforma 3. Check if the changes are reflected in Oxygen Possible fix: Move `clone.save()` (https://github.com/PressLabs/silver/blob/master/silver/models.py#L1516) right before the return statement. This will have the effect of creating the triggering the `updated` event => the changes will show up in Oxygen.
text_for_topic_modeling: Investigate/fix updates on cloned invoice/proforma 1. Clone a proforma 2. Make some changes to that proforma 3. Check if the changes are reflected in Oxygen Possible fix: Move `clone.save()` (https://github.com/PressLabs/silver/blob/master/silver/models.py#L1516) right before the return statement. This will have the effect of creating the triggering the `updated` event => the changes will show up in Oxygen. source-file

title: Django 1.9
description: Current stable version of Django is 1.9.2. Django 1.9 has some nice features (new lookups, new core features, improved template engine etc) and bug fixes. Do you have any plans to support Django 1.9? Also, why are you using `django-international`? This package is pre-alpha and last update was in 2014. This can create some problems for update to newer version of Django. Any reasons why this package depends of Django 1.8.3? The latest version of Django 1.8 is 1.8.9.
